episode_title: 505 - The One With All the Kips

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, 3:02 A.M., Chandler is up. There’s a knock on the door and Chandler answers it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi! (They both start kissing.)
(Joey enters and Chandler pushes her away.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Monica? What time is it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uhh, 9. (He pushes the clock into the sink.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But it’s dark out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well that’s because you always sleep to noon, silly! This is what 9 looks like.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I guess I’ll get washed up then. Watch that sunrise. (He goes into the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m really getting tired of sneaking around.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know, me too. Hey! Y’know what if we went away for a whole weekend? Y’know we’d have no interruptions and we could be naked the entire time.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All weekend? That’s a whole lotta naked.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I can say that I have a conference and you can say you have a chef thing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh, I’ve always wanted to go to this culinary fair that they have in Jersey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, y’know your not though. Let’s go. (He starts for his bedroom.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait! What about Joey?
(Chandler opens the bathroom door to reveal Joey passed out on the toilet with a toothbrush in his mouth.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the next morning, Chandler, Joey, and Phoebe are eating breakfast.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, guess what I’m doing this weekend! I’m going to this culinary fair in New Jersey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh weird, Chandler just told us he’s got a conference there!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh now that-that-that’s funny, it seems like Chandler’s conference could’ve been in Connecticut or Vermont.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not in charge of where the conference is held. Do you want people to think it’s a fake conference? It’s a real conference.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is Rachel here? I gotta talk to her.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, she’s out shopping.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Damn!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s going on?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I told Emily to come. And I just need to y’know, talk to Rachel about it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait a minute! So when Emily comes you’re just, you’re not gonna see Rachel anymore?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well look, I’m just trying to focus on the “I get to see my wife,” part, all right? And not the part that makes me do this. (He takes a big swig of Pepto Bismol .)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow, so you guys are, you’re never gonna be in the same room together? How is that even gonna work?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I have no idea. I mean… But-but I assure you I will figure it out.
(They all reflect briefly on what was said.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Doesn’t seem like it’s going to work, I mean…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, guys!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s going on?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We’re flipping Monica’s mattress.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So I’m thinking, basically we pick it up and then we flip it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah that’s better than my way.
(They all agree and head to Monica’s room.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh okay, hey guys, would you flip mine too?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Aww, man! (They go into Monica’s room.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh look! A letter from my mom.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, Rach, y’know-y’know how Emily’s coming right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah! I know.
[Cut to Monica’s bedroom, Chandler is trying to listen through the door.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Can you hear anything?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yes, somebody just said, “Can you hear anything?”
(Joey is bent over at the waist and is looking for something under Monica’s bed.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, Joey’s ass! What are you doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, remember when they got in that big fight and broke up and we were all stuck in her with no food or anything? Well, when Ross said Rachel at the wedding, I figured it was gonna happen again, so I hid this in here.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ooh, candy bars, crossword puzzles…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, Madlibs , mine! (Grabs it.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Condoms?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You don’t know how long we’re gonna be in here! We may have to repopulate the Earth.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And condoms are the way to do that?
[Cut to the living room.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Anyway it-it kinda-it all boils down to this, the last time I talked to Emily…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! My dog died!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, Le Poo, our dog!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Le Poo’s still alive?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God, it says he was hit by an ice cream truck and dragged for nine-(turns over the note)-teen blocks. Oh. (They all come out from Monica’s bedroom) Oh my God.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sweetie, we heard you crying. Please don’t cry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s Le Poo.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know it’s le poo right now, but it’ll get better.

content.description: Atlantic City, New Jersey, Chandler and Monica are about to start their weekend of sex, sex, nothing but sex.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe it! We’re here!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ooh, chocolates on the pillows! I love that!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, you should live with Joey, Roll-os everywhere.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come here. (He does, and they kiss.) Okay, be right back.
(Goes to the bathroom and Chandler turns on the TV and finds a high-speed police chase.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yes! Monica, get in here! There’s a high-speed car chase on!
(Monica returns, carrying a glass.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re switching rooms.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh dear God, they gave us glasses!
content.parenthetical: looks at what she’s holding and shies away

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, they gave us glasses with lipstick on them! I mean, if they didn’t change the glasses, who knows what else they didn’t change. (He glares at her.) Come on sweetie, I just want this weekend to be perfect, I mean we can change rooms, can’t we?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, but let’s do it now though, because Chopper 5 just lost it’s feed! (He grabs their bags and sprints out.)

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is trying to tell Rachel about Emily’s ultimatum again.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, so uh, y’know how there’s something I wanted to talk to you about?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah! (Turns to face him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, y’know how I’m trying to work things out with Emily. Well, there’s this one thing… Okay, (Rachel has her back turned to the camera, and Ross isn’t looking at her.) here goes. I made a promise that-(they cut to the other camera and Ross notices something coming out of Rachel’s nose)-Oh hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re nose is bleeding!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God. (He hands her some tissues.) No! Oh not again! (Wiping her nose.) This-this happened when my grandfather died. It’s ugh! Sorry. (She puts her head back.) Oh, okay, so I’m sorry, what-what were you-what did you want to tell me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm… (Rachel blows her nose.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sorry. Sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I uh, I can’t see you anymore.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I know. It’s ridiculous! I can’t see you either.

content.description: Chandler and Monica’s weekend, a hotel clerk is showing them their new room.

content.speaker: Hotel Clerk
content.text: I think you’ll find this room more to your liking.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, great. (He grabs the remote and turns on the TV to the chase.)

content.speaker: Hotel Clerk
content.text: They say he’s only got half a tank left.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Half a tank? We still got a lot of high-speed chasing to do!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re switching rooms again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What? Why?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is a garden view room, and we paid for an ocean view room.

content.speaker: Hotel Clerk
content.text: Our last ocean view room was unacceptable to you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Excuse me, umm, can I talk to you over here for just a second?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh-huh. (He doesn’t take his eyes off the TV.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look, these clowns are trying to take us for a ride and I’m not gonna let ’em! And we’re not a couple of suckers!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I hear ya, Mugsy! But look, all these rooms are fine okay? Can you just pick one so I can watch-(realizes)-have a perfect, magical weekend together with you.
[Time lapse, Monica and Chandler have changed rooms yet again.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, this one I like!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nothing! It’s over! Dammit! This is regularly scheduled programming!
content.parenthetical: watching TV, in fact, ER is on.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Can we turn the TV off? Okay? Do we really want to spend the entire weekend like this?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry, am I getting in the way of all the room switching fun?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, don’t blame me for wigging tonight!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, who should I blame? The nice bell man who had to drag out luggage to 10 different rooms?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know, how about the idiot who thought he could drive from Albany to Canada on a half a tank of gas!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do not speak ill of the dead.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re supposed to uh, be spending a romantic weekend together, it-it, what is the matter with you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I just want to watch a little television. What is the big deal? Geez, relax mom.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What did you say?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I said, “Geez, relax Monnnnn.”

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is reading a magazine and has two tissues stuck up her nose in an attempt to stop the bleeding and as she hears Ross enter, she quickly hides her face behind the magazine and removes the tissues.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey. Rachel, I-I-I’ve been wanting to tell you something for a while now and I really, I just have to get it out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, what’s up?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, y’know how you told me I should do whatever it takes to fix my marriage?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I told you to give Emily whatever she wants.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And while that was good advice, you should know that what-what she wants…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …is for me not to see you anymore.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s crazy! You can’t do that! What are you going to tell her? (Pause) (Realizes) Oh God. Ohh, you already agreed to this, haven’t you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s awful I know, I mean, I feel terrible but I have to do this if I want my marriage to work. And I do, I have to make this marriage work. I have too. But the good thing is we can still see each other until she gets here.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! Lucky me! Oh my God! That is good news, Ross! I think that’s the best news I’ve heard since Le Poo died!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You have no idea what a nightmare this has been. This is so hard.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah, really? Is it Ross? Yeah? Okay, well let me make this a just a little bit easier for you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Storming out!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rachel, this is your apartment.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, well that’s how mad I am!!

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is returning from his disastrous weekend. He throws his bag down and sits down on one of the leather chairs, but he sits on something and picks it up and throws it away.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Damn Rollos !

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, you’re back!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How was your conference?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It was terrible. I fought with (Pause) my colleagues y’know, the entire time. Are you kidding with this? (Throws away another Rollo )

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, so your weekend was a total bust?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, no, I got to see Donald Trump waiting for an elevator.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, you’re back too!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. Umm, Chandler can I talk to you outside for a second?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, how was your chef thing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, it was awful. (To Chandler) I guess some people just don’t appreciate really good food.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, maybe it was the kind of food that tasted good at first but then made everybody vomit and have diarrhea.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler! (Motions for him to come outside.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica. (Follows her out.)
[In the hall.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I’d like to know how much the room was because I’d like to pay my half.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, fine, $300.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: 300 dollars?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, just think of it as $25 per room!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Urghh!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are you guys woofing about?
content.parenthetical: sticking his head out the door

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler stole a twenty from my purse!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nooooo!!! Y’know what? Now that I think about it, I constantly find myself without twenties and you always have lots!

content.description: [Scene: Central Perk, Ross is drinking some Alka-Seltzer. The rest of the gang, minus Rachel is there as well.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You should’ve seen the look on her face. I don’t want Rachel to hate me! I don’t know what to do.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You want my advice?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes! Please!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re not gonna like it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You got married to fast.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s not advice!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I told ya.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m going to the bathroom. (Gets up and exits.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Man, if anyone asked me to give up any of you, I couldn’t do it.

content.speaker: Chandler and Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, me either.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Maybe I could do it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi, Rach.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look, I know you guys heard about the whole thing with me and Ross but y’know, I’ve been obsessing about it all day and I’d just love not to talk about it. All right?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I-I-I don’t know if this falls under this category, but uh, Ross is right back there. (Points over his shoulder.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s not Ross!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no! Not that guy! He does look like him though.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, Ross is in the bathroom.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, its happening. It’s already started. I’m Kip.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, you’re not Kip!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do you even know who Kip is?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who cares? You’re Rachel! (To Chandler) Who’s Kip?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Kip, my old roommate, y’know we all used to hang out together.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, that poor bastard.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: See? Yeah, you told me the story. He and Monica dated when they broke up they couldn’t even be in the same room together and you all promised that you would stay his friend and what happened? He got phased out!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re not gonna be phased out!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, of course I am! It’s not gonna happen to Ross! He’s your brother. (To Chandler) He’s your old college roommate. Ugh, it was just a matter of time before someone had to leave the group. I just always assumed Phoebe would be the one to go.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ehh!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, come on! You live far away! You’re not related. You lift right out.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is watching TV.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Mr. Bing. That uh, hotel you stayed at called. Said someone left an eyelash curler in your room.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes that was mine.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: ’Cause I figured you’d hooked up with some girl and she’d left it there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes that would have made more sense.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know, I-I don’t even feel like I know you anymore man! All right, look, I’m just gonna ask you this one time. And whatever you say, I’ll believe ya. (Pause.) Were you, or were you not on a gay cruise?!

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is sitting on couch and Rachel is getting some coffee. Phoebe keeps turning her head from to keep from looking at Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe? (She turns her head further away.) I’m sorry about the whole lifting out thing. (Moves over next to her.) You gotta come with me!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come where?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wherever I go. Come on you and me, we’ll-we’ll start a new group, we’re the best ones.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, but try and get Joey too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pheebs, you mind if I speak to Rachel alone for a sec?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, sure! (She gets up to leave.) Bye Ross! (Whispering behind his back.) Forever.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi. What are you doing here? Isn’t this against the rules?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I talked to Monica, look, I’m the one who made the choice. I’m the one who’s making things change, so I should be the one to y’know, step back.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Ross…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, it’s okay. Really. They’re plenty of people who just see their sisters at Thanksgiving and just see their college roommates at reunions and just see Joey at Burger King . So is, is that better?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, it’s not better. I still don’t get to see you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, what-what would you do? Rach, if you were me, what-what would you do?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, for starters I would’ve said the right name at my wedding!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can’t believe this is happening.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I am so sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know that too.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: (He clears his throat to get their attention.) Hey, Rach? Sorry to interrupt but umm, Phoebe wanted me to talk to you about a trip or something.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is doing a crossword puzzle.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I just came over to drop off…nothing. So that weekend kinda sucked, huh?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, it did.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, I guess this is over.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, y’know, you and me, it had to end sometime.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why, exactly?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because of the weekend, we had a fight.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler that’s crazy! If you give up every time you’d have a fight with someone you’d never be with anyone longer than—Ohhh! (They both realize something there.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, this isn’t over?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You are so cute! No. No, it was a fight. You deal with it and move on! It’s nothing to freak out about.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really? Okay. Great!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh, welcome to an adult relationship! (She goes to kiss him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We’re in a relationship?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m afraid so.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.
(They kiss.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica, Rachel, Joey, and Chandler are there as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh hey, Monica, I heard you saw Donald Trump at your convention.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, I saw him waiting for an elevator.
(Joey thinks that sounds familiar, but dismisses the thought.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, Rach, can I borrow your eyelash curler, I think I lost mine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, it’s in there. (Points to the bathroom.)
(Joey puts two and two together.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh! Ohh! Oh!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey, can I talk to you for a second? (He grabs him and starts to drag Joey into Monica’s room.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oohh!! Ohh! Oh-oh-oh! Oh-oh!!
(Chandler pushes him through the door and Monica closes it behind them.)
[Cut to Monica’s room, Chandler tackles Joey onto her bed and tries to cover his mouth.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohhhhhhhhhhh!!!!!!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes. Yes. (Lets him up.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You?! (To Monica) And-and you?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes, but you cannot tell anyone! No one knows!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How?! When?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It happened in London.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: IN LONDON!!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The reason we didn’t tell anyone was because we didn’t want to make a big deal out of it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But it is a big deal!! I have to tell someone!
(They both grab him and stop him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no-no-no-no! You can’t!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Please? Please?! We just don’t want to deal with telling everyone, okay? Just promise you won’t tell.
(Joey thinks it over.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right! Man, this is unbelievable! I mean, it’s great , but…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know, it’s great!
(She goes over and kisses Chandler.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aww, I don’t want to see that!
[Cut to Phoebe and Rachel.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We’re so stupid! Do you know what’s going on in there? They’re trying to take Joey!

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s, the gang, minus Ross are playing Madlibs. Phoebe is reading hers.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: The most popular Phoebe in tennis is called the overhand Phoebe. And if you win, you must slap your opponent on the Phoebe and say, “Hi, Phoebe!”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh that’s cute! We really all enjoyed it. But y’know, it doesn’t count.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Count for what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Count in our heads as-as good Madlibs .
(They putting their notepads down and get up to leave.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I guess I’m done.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fun’s over!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait-wait, guys! If-if we follow the rules, it’s still fun and it means something!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I think I’m gonna take-off.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Guys, rules are good! Rules help control the fun! (They all leave and close the door on Monica.) Ohhh! (Throws her notepad down in disgust.)
